column3: `dumpwallet` requires that you dump to a file then find that file and open it to get the master private key. This just gives it to you with the command.
@jonasschnelli there is no sensitive data filter for the `dump*` commands. The user is not entering sensitive data, only sensitive data being output.
Addressed nits and added a test.\n\nIt may need more tests, but I'm not sure what actually needs to be tested.

> @jonasschnelli there is no sensitive data filter for the dump* commands. The user is not entering sensitive data, only sensitive data being output.\n\nArgh. Right. I was confusing the sensitiv history filter with the idea of having a filter that disables certain sensitive commands.
Well,... you need the masterKeys `CKeyID` anyway,... but I guess it would still make sense to use `CWallet::IsHDEnabled()`
